p: Long-term administration of Z. multiflora hydroethanolic extract also caused a reduction in tracheobronchial hyperresponsiveness in animal model of asthma [ 43] and COPD [ 42]. The possible antagonistic effect of the hydroethanolic extract of Z. multiflora on muscarinic receptors of incubated tracheal chains with propranolol and chlorpheniramine versus to those of nonincubated tissue was investigated [ 50].
